item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All art is quite useless." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "There are two motives for reading a book; one, that you enjoy it; the other, that you can boast about it." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Now I can look at you in peace; I don't eat you any more." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by franz kafka
item.description: "Slept, awoke, slept, awoke, miserable life." -- franz kafka

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "I want you always to remember me. Will you remember that I existed, and that I stood next to you here like this?" -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "There they lay, but not in the forgetfulness of the previous night. She was seeking and he was seeking, they raged and contorted their faces and bored their heads into each others bosom in the urgency of seeking something, and their embraces and their tossing limbs did not avail to make them forget, but only reminded them of what they sought" -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "I can’t think of any greater happiness than to be with you all the time, without interruption, endlessly, even though I feel that here in this world there’s no undisturbed place for our love, neither in the village nor anywhere else; and I dream of a grave, deep and narrow, where we could clasp each other in our arms as with clamps, and I would hide my face in you and you would hide your face in me, and nobody would ever see us any more." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "War is what happens when language fails." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "I would like to be the air that inhabits you for a moment only. I would like to be that unnoticed and that necessary." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Books are the ultimate Dumpees: put them down and they’ll wait for you forever; pay attention to them and they always love you back." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "The only way out of the labyrinth of suffering is to forgive." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You don't get to choose if you get hurt in this world...but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a slut time is. She screws everybody." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Thomas Edison's last words were 'It's very beautiful over there'. I don't know where there is, but I believe it's somewhere, and I hope it's beautiful." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What a treacherous thing to believe that a person is more than a person." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Some infinities are bigger than other infinities." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You can love someone so much...But you can never love people as much as you can miss them." -- John Green

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Bill Keane
item.description: "Yesterday is history, tomorrow is a mystery, today is a gift of God, which is why we call it the present." -- Bill Keane

item.title: Sai Thein Than add a quote by Stephenie Meyer
item.description: "I like the night. Without the dark, we'd never see the stars." -- Stephenie Meyer
